Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery vessel, possibly a thick-walled krater or dinos; greyish slip; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of two friezes; in upper frieze, part of two sirens to left; in lower, possibly geese to left; added white on head of sirens and on alternate tail feathers.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.053) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
